title: Drawing, "Design for a Curtain,  Park Synagogue, Cleveland Heights, Ohio", ca. 1960
medium: Cut paper, brush and gouache on gold-patterned Chinese paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink on old mat beneath drawing, left:  Curtain: Gold/Tempel (sic) Cleveland; at right:  Trude Guermonprez/Pond Farm/Guerneville
provenance: Eric Elsesser, California; 1993: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Recto:  vertical design of silver, orange, gold, blue, and turquoise stripes with chevron decoration on gold ground.  Verso:  Horizontal design of seven-branched menorah with vertical tree branches at left; framing lines drawn on top of design.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Curtain,  Park Synagogue, Cleveland Heights, Ohio", ca. 1960.Cut paper, brush and gouache on gold-patterned Chinese paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-66.
